https://www.thetimes.com/world/europe/ar.title: Euro 2020: Fans injured by Greenpeace parachute protester
https://www.thetimes.com/world/europe/ar.text:
Uefa has confirmed that “several people” are being treated in the hospital for injuries caused by a Greenpeace protester who parachuted into a football stadium before France’s victory over Germany in their Euro 2020 game in Munich.
European football’s governing body said that the “law authorities will take the necessary action” for what it called a “reckless and dangerous” act.
Debris fell onto the pitch and into the stands when the parachutist got tangled in wires carrying an overhead camera. France’s head coach, Didier Deschamps, was seen having to duck out of the way of a large piece of equipment that fell near the dugout.
The activist, who was protesting against Volkswagen, the tournament sponsor, had the words “Kick out oil! Greenpeace” written on
image: As he descended, the parachutist was caught on cables carrying an overhead camera
author: John Reynolds
